qas.question: Where is Tibet ranked among China's 31 provinces on the UN's Human Development Index?
What has increased tourism to Tibet in recent years?
From which area does tourism bring the most income?

plausible_answers.text: barley, wheat, buckwheat, rye, potatoes, and assorted fruits and vegetables.

qas.question: What are the main crops grown in China?
Where is Tibet ranked out of China's 13 provinces on the Human Development Index?
What percentage of Tibet's tourism comes from the sale of handicrafts?

context: The main crops grown are <b4_0>barley, wheat, buckwheat, rye, potatoes, and assorted fruits and vegetables.<b4_0/> Tibet is ranked <b5_0>the <a0_0>lowest<b5_0/><a0_0/> among China’s 31 provinces on the Human Development Index according to UN Development Programme data. In recent years, due to <a1_0>increased interest in Tibetan Buddhism<a1_0/>, tourism has become an increasingly important sector, and is actively promoted by the authorities. Tourism brings in the most income from the <a3_0>sale of handicrafts<a3_0/>. These include Tibetan hats, jewelry (silver and gold), wooden items, clothing, quilts, fabrics, Tibetan rugs and carpets. The Central People's Government exempts Tibet from <a2_0>all taxation<a2_0/> and provides <b6_0>90%<b6_0/> of Tibet's government expenditures. However most of this investment goes to pay migrant workers who do not settle in Tibet and send much of their income home to other provinces.
